description: From Middle French malignant, from Late Latin malignans. See malign.

adjectives.description: malignant (comparative more malignant, superlative most malignant)

examples: malignant temper;  malignant revenge;  malignant infection

entries.meaning: (medicine) Tending to produce death; threatening a fatal issue.
A deviant; a person who is hostile or destructive to society.
examples: As devout Stephen was carried to his burial by devout men, so is it just and equal that malignants should carry malignants  […]

entries.meaning: (historical, derogatory, obsolete) A person who fought for Charles I in the English Civil War.
